questiontext.text:
Key point

The unique solution to the equations:

\(\qquad ax+by=e\)

\(\qquad cx+dy=f\)

is given by:

\(\qquad x=\dfrac{\Delta_x}{\Delta},\ \ y=\dfrac{\Delta_y}{\Delta}\)

in which

\(\qquad\Delta=\left|\begin{array}{cc}a&b\\ c&d\end{array}\right|,\ \ \Delta_x=\left|\begin{array}{cc}e&b\\ f&d\end{array}\right|,\ \ \Delta_y=\left|\begin{array}{cc}a&e\\ c&f\end{array}\right|.\)

If \(\Delta=0\) this method of solution cannot be used.
